q:
In hypothesis testing, you are given the following three graphs. Each graph is associated with a letter (Graph 1-A, Graph 2-B, and Graph 3-C) that represents a colored area. Which of these statements about the provided graphs is correct:

Note: Here, \(H_a\) represents the hypothesis and \(\mu\) represents the mean.

Graph 1

Graph 2

Graph 3

Statements

  1. Graph 1 represents a right-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in area A. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu > value\) relationship.
    Graph 2-B represents a left-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in area B. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu < value\) relationship.
    Graph 3-C represents a two-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in the areas that are marked as C. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu \not= value\) relationship.
  2. Graph 1 represents a left-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in area A. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu > value\) relationship.
    Graph 2-B represents a right-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in area B. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu < value\) relationship.
    Graph 3-C represents a two-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in the areas that are marked as C. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu \not= value\) relationship.
  3. Graph 1 represents a right-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in the area outside A (the white region). Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu < value\) relationship.
    Graph 2-B represents a left-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in the area outside B (the white region). Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu > value\) relationship.
    Graph 3-C represents a two-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in the areas that are not marked as C (the white region). Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu = value\) relationship.
  4. Graph 1 represents a right-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in area A. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu < value\) relationship.
    Graph 2-B represents a left-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in area B. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu >value\) relationship.
    Graph 3-C represents a two-tail test. \(H_a\) is more probable in the areas that are marked as C. Also, it represents \(H_a: \mu = value\) relationship.

You work in a petroleum company where every supply vehicle is given an IoT device. You are given the data of an IoT device from a specific vehicle which has the following characteristics:

  • It contains the timestamp location and speed.
  • The time difference between the two consecutive data points on this device is 5s.

You notice an anomaly in the data that is there are three readings for the same timestamp and speed but no data is missing.

Which of the following methods can be used to overcome this problem:

  1. Take the mean of all the three observations with respect to the location and remove two out of the three repeated observations.
  2. Take the mean of the speed given in all the three observations and remove two out of the three repeated observations.

In Linear Algebra, you are given the following function \(g(z)\). Determine the approximate value of \(\sqrt[4]{3}\) and \(\sqrt[4]{10}\)  using the linear approximation method. 

Function

\(g(z) = \sqrt[4]{z}\) at \(z = 2\)

Options

  1. \(L(3) = 1.33786\) and \(L(10) = 2.37841\)
  2. \(L(3) = 2.37841\) and \(L(10) = 1.33789\)
  3. \(L(3) = 3.10821 \) and \(L(10) = 2.33789\)
  4. \(L(3) = 2.78241\) and \(L(10) = 2.02189\)

You are given a training dataset. This dataset contains independent variables \(X=(x_1,x_2\dots x_n)\) and the corresponding target variables \(t=(t_1,t_2,\dots t_n)\). Here, \(X\) represents random variables that lie uniformly between \([0, 1]\). The target dataset \(t\) is obtained by substituting the value of \(X\) into the function \(sin(2πx)\) and then adding some Gaussian noise into it.

Your task is to determine the following:

  1. The pattern in the data set.
  2. Generalize the pattern to predict the corresponding target value for some new values of \(x\).

The problem here is that the dataset is inflicted with some random noise. Thus, making it difficult to find the function in the training data set. You apply the Taylor series. The following graph represents the target variable versus the input variable, that is, \(y = sin(2πx)\). It contains the provided properties.

Which of these statements about this scenario are correct:

Graph

Properties of the graph

  • The blue circle denotes the training data points.
  • The green curve represents the expected polynomial function that fits the training data set.
  • The red curve denotes the polynomial function of various degrees (given by variable M) that are trained to fit the data set.

Statements

  1. The polynomial of degree 9 is able to make accurate predictions for all the data points in the training set.
  2. The polynomial of degree 9 is not able to make accurate predictions for all the data points in the training set.
  3. The function with degree 3 is able to fit our training data.
  4. The function with degree 3 is a subset of polynomials of a high order.
  5. The function of order 9 represents overfitting.

In Linear Algebra, you are given the following three graphs. Which of these statements about the provided graphs is correct?

Graph 1

Graph 2

Graph 3

Statements

  1. All the graphs are linearly independent:
    Graph 1—One solution
    Graph 2—Infinite number of solutions
    Graph 3—No solution 
  2. All the graphs are linearly independent:
    Graph 1—No solution
    Graph 2—Infinite number of solutions
    Graph 3—One solution only
  3. All the graphs are linearly independent:
    Graph 1—Infinite number of solutions
    Graph 2—One solution only
    Graph 3—No solution
  4. All the graphs are linearly dependent. 
    Graph 1—No solution
    Graph 2—Infinite number of solutions
    Graph 3—One solution only
In Machine Learning, you want to select the Features columns from specific data. Which of these options can be used to perform this task?
